oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reliability studies on sub 100 nm SOI-MNSFETs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAHAPATRA, S
RAMGOPAL RAO, V
VASI, J
CHENG, B
WOO, JCS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: misfet
hot carriers
low-power electronics
semiconductor device reliability
silicon-on-insulator
vapour deposited coatings
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: SOI MNSFETs with channel lengths down to 100 nm and having a Jet Vapor Deposited (JVD) silicon nitride (Si3N4) gate dielectric are fabricated and characterized. The JVD MNSFETs show comparable performance in comparison to conventional SiO2 SOI-MOSFETs, in terms of low gate leakage, Si3N4/Si interface quality and Ion/I off ratio. In addition, the MNSFETs show better hot carrier reliability compared to conventional MOSFETs. Our results explore the worthiness of JVD Si3N4 as gate dielectric for future low power ULSI applications.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Proceeding of the IEEE International Integrated Reliability Workshop Final Report, Lake Tahoe, USA, 23-26 October 2000, 29-31
